QuestionJSON.Question: Tiger is a swim coach who is tracking their team's progress. They have created a graph that shows the number of laps each swimmer can swim over time. Tiger notices that one of the swimmer's lap counts is consistently increasing. Can Tiger predict the performance of this swimmer in the future?
QuestionJSON.Answer1: Yes, Tiger can predict the swimmer will continue to improve as long as the pattern continues.
QuestionJSON.Answer2: No, Tiger cannot predict the swimmer's future performance as it's dependent on the swimmer's health on the day of the swim.
QuestionJSON.Answer3: Yes, Tiger can predict the swimmer will swim a constant number of laps in every training session.
QuestionJSON.Answer4: No, Tiger cannot make any predictions because swimming performance is unpredictable.
QuestionJSON.Explanation: Data visualizations such as patterns in charts or graphs help to make predictions. So, in this case, if the lap count is consistently increasing over time, it suggests that the swimmer's performance is likely to continue improving in the future.
